latest news.eng_title: Obama: 'It's Now Up to Us to Fight for the America We Believe In'
latest news.summary: Former US President Barack Obama addressed the Democratic Party convention in Chicago, stating that the upcoming presidential election is a crucial battle for the America that Democrats believe in. He criticized Donald Trump, calling him a 78-year-old billionaire who constantly complains about his problems. Obama said, 'It's now up to us to fight for the America we believe in. Don't be fooled, it will be a fight.' He also praised Kamala Harris, saying she is someone who sees and hears the people and fights for them every day. Obama's speech came as the Democratic Party convention continues in Chicago, with a focus on the 'fight for freedom' of Americans. The convention has featured discussions on topics such as Trump's agenda, artificial intelligence and deepfakes in the 2024 elections, and Israel after October 7. Former President Bill Clinton and Vice Presidential candidate Tim Walz are scheduled to speak at the convention. Meanwhile, Hillary Clinton, the wife of Bill Clinton and a former US presidential candidate, has been sending text messages in support of Kamala Harris's campaign, asking for donations. It is unclear if Harris will attend the convention in person, but her official acceptance speech is scheduled for Thursday.
latest news.title: Obama: "Jetzt liegt es an uns, für das Amerika zu kämpfen, an das wir glauben"

latest news.eng_title: DNC 2024 live updates: Watch Barack and Michelle Obama deliver keynote speeches endorsing Kamala Harris
latest news.summary: The second night of the Democratic National Convention (DNC) featured speeches from former President Barack Obama, former first lady Michelle Obama, and second gentleman Doug Emhoff, among others. Michelle Obama emphasized the importance of hope and criticized Donald Trump, saying 'Who's going to tell [Trump] that the job he's currently seeking might be one of those Black jobs?' Doug Emhoff praised his wife Kamala Harris, saying 'Kamala rises to the occasion,' and 'She brings both joy and toughness to this task.' Sen. Tammy Duckworth criticized Republican opposition to in vitro fertilization, saying 'After 10 years of struggling with infertility, I was only able to have them through the miracle of IVF.' The convention also featured a ceremonial roll call, where delegates from each state cast their votes for Harris and her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz. California and Minnesota, Harris's and Walz's home states, initially 'passed' on endorsing them, but later did so. The convention will continue through Thursday.
latest news.title: DNC 2024 live updates: Watch Barack and Michelle Obama deliver keynote speeches endorsing Kamala Harris

latest news.eng_title: What time is Obama speaking at DNC? Timing, how to watch the address live
latest news.summary: Former President Barack Obama and former First Lady Michelle Obama will headline the second day of the 2024 Democratic National Convention in Chicago on Tuesday evening. Michelle Obama is scheduled to speak at 10 p.m., followed by Barack Obama. The Obamas have spoken at the last four Democratic National Conventions, with Barack Obama also delivering the keynote address at the 2004 DNC in Boston. According to convention organizers, the theme for Tuesday's events is 'A bold vision for America's future,' a defined pivot toward a new generation for Democrats and their leadership. Michelle Obama is expected to argue how Vice Presidential candidate Kamala Harris' experiences and values make her qualified to serve as president, while Barack Obama will focus on what Democrats need to do to defeat Trump in the general election. The event will be live-streamed on NBC Chicago's website and social media channels.
latest news.title: What time is Obama speaking at DNC? Timing, how to watch the address live

latest news.eng_title: Biden ushers in 2024 Democratic National Convention as Harris prepares to officially accept nomination
latest news.summary: President Joe Biden officially handed the reins to Vice President Kamala Harris at the Democratic National Convention (DNC) on August 19. Harris is expected to officially accept the party's nomination on August 22. Biden spoke on his economic successes, including 'record small business growth' and a $2,000 out-of-pocket cap for prescription costs. He also acknowledged the results of his executive action to tighten security at the U.S.-Mexico border, which has led to a 50% drop in border encounters. Former President Bill Clinton spoke about Harris' past as a lawyer and highlighted her commitment to fighting for women's rights. Clinton said, 'No matter what the polls say, we can't let up. We have to fight for Kamala as she will fight for us.' The DNC will continue with a variety of sessions and caucuses, including a speech from former President Barack Obama and a session on how women in politics can combat misinformation created via artificial intelligence.
latest news.title: Biden ushers in 2024 Democratic National Convention as Harris prepares to officially accept nomination

latest news.eng_title: When is Obama speaking at DNC? What to know
latest news.summary: Former President Barack Obama and former First Lady Michelle Obama will speak at the 2024 Democratic National Convention on Tuesday night. While the exact timing and order of speakers has not been released, they are expected to headline the convention's second night. The theme for Tuesday's events is 'A bold vision for America's future,' and the Obamas' speeches will contrast with the less positive outlook on America's future presented by Trump. According to the Harris campaign, Michelle Obama will argue how Harris' experiences and values make her qualified to serve as president, while her husband will focus on what Democrats need to do to defeat Trump in the general election. Other speakers on Tuesday include Doug Emhoff, Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker, U.S. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, and Sen. Bernie Sanders. NBC Chicago will offer a live feed of speeches each day through Thursday in the player above and on the NBC 5 Chicago News 24/7 streaming channel.
latest news.title: When is Obama speaking at DNC? What to know

latest news.eng_title: Who is speaking at the DNC tonight? Day 2 speaker list and schedule
latest news.summary: The 2024 Democratic National Convention in Chicago will continue on its second day with a lineup of prominent speakers, including former President Barack Obama, former First Lady Michelle Obama, and other high-profile names. The convention's theme for Tuesday is 'A Bold Vision for America's Future,' which will focus on moving the country forward and building upon the work of the Biden Administration. Michelle Obama is expected to argue how Vice President Kamala Harris' experiences and values make her qualified to serve as president, while her husband will focus on what Democrats need to do to defeat Trump in the general election. Other speakers expected on Tuesday include Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker, Sen. Bernie Sanders, and Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff. Multiple Republican leaders, including former U.S. Rep. Adam Kinzinger and former Georgia Lt. Gov. Geoff Duncan, will also offer remarks at the convention. The speeches will be livestreamed on NBC Chicago's website and mobile app, as well as on the NBC 5 Chicago News 24/7 Streaming Channel.
latest news.title: Who is speaking at the DNC tonight? Day 2 speaker list and schedule

latest news.eng_title: The Moment the Future Begins for the Democrats
latest news.summary: At the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Kamala Harris took the stage to deliver the keynote speech, a moment that marked the beginning of the future for the Democrats. Harris praised Joe Biden, saying 'I thank you for your historic leadership, for your lifelong service to our nation, and for everything you will continue to do.' She also quoted Biden's famous phrase 'If we fight, we win.' Harris emphasized that she will be a president who will 'always stand up for us and fight for us,' unlike Donald Trump, who only cares about himself. Biden then took the stage, delivering a passionate and emotional speech, thanking his supporters and promising to be a 'good volunteer' for Harris. He praised Harris, saying 'She will be a president who will be respected by the leaders of the world because she already is. She will be a president who we can all be proud of, and she will be a historic president who will put her stamp on America's future.' The moment marked the beginning of the future for the Democrats, with Harris and her running mate Tim Walz set to take on Trump in the upcoming election.
latest news.title: Der Moment, an dem für die Demokraten die Zukunft beginnt

latest news.eng_title: When will Harris speak at the Chicago TNC? What to know
latest news.summary: The 2024 Democratic National Convention will conclude with Kamala Harris' acceptance speech in Chicago, marking the party's coming together on a single vision for the next four years. Harris has generally supported the main goals of the Biden administration and has laid out new economic proposals, but has not released a detailed list of his policy positions. Harris is expected to attend the convention on Monday, but the exact timing of his acceptance speech is yet to be announced. The convention will be streamed live on NBC Chicago's website and mobile app, as well as on Telemundo Chicago and the Telemundo Chicago app. 'The largely ceremonial vote at the Chicago convention will mark the party's coming together on a single vision for the next four years,' according to NBC News. 'Harris has generally spoken about supporting the main goals of the Biden administration, which have been more or less endorsed on the platform as written.'
latest news.title: When will Harris speak at the Chicago TNC? What to know

latest news.eng_title: Trump Uses AI-Generated Image to Attack Kamala Harris Before Democratic Convention
latest news.summary: Donald Trump has published an image generated by AI of Kamala Harris giving a speech to a crowd with a communist flag in the background, in an attempt to discredit her before the Democratic National Convention in Chicago. Trump has been attacking Harris, who is leading in national polls and in seven key states, with a barrage of criticism. The image, which appears to be Harris speaking at a rally with a large banner featuring the Soviet Union's hammer and sickle symbol, is a clear reference to the upcoming convention in Illinois. Harris is expected to formally accept the Democratic presidential nomination on Thursday, and will deliver a speech outlining her plans for the future, which contradict Trump's claims of the country's decline. Trump has also accused Harris of being a 'communist' and a 'fascist', citing her economic policies and a speech she gave in Raleigh, North Carolina, where she criticized the supposed 'increase in food prices'. Trump said, 'Kamala announced that she wants to implement socialist policies to control prices. They will have noticed that this strategy never works. Instead, it will cause scarcity, hunger, and runaway inflation.'
latest news.title: Trump publica imagen de Kamala Harris generada mediante IA

latest news.eng_title: When does Kamala Harris speak at the Democratic convention? What to know and how to watch.
latest news.summary: The 2024 Democratic National Convention begins on Monday in Chicago, where Democrats will make their pitch to voters. Vice President Kamala Harris is expected to accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination on Thursday night. Other notable speakers include President Joe Biden, former President Barack Obama, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, and former first lady Michelle Obama. The convention will air live on the DNC's website and on USA TODAY's YouTube channel from August 19-22. Harris is expected to attend the first night on Monday following her bus tour through Pennsylvania. 'The convention will be a crucial moment for Democrats to showcase their vision and leadership,' according to the DNC.
latest news.title: When does Kamala Harris speak at the Democratic convention? What to know and how to watch.

news knowledge.eng_title: Trump posts AI-generated image of Harris speaking at DNC with communist flags
news knowledge.summary: Donald Trump has posted an AI-generated image of Kamala Harris speaking at the Democratic National Convention (DNC) with communist flags, in an attempt to undermine her ahead of the convention. The image shows Harris speaking to a crowd with a hammer and sickle, the symbol of the Soviet Union, in the background. Trump has been making personal attacks on Harris, including accusing her of being 'full communist' and 'fascist', despite her economic policies being aimed at addressing price gouging. The DNC is expected to draw over 50,000 visitors, including delegates, journalists, and invited guests, and will feature speeches from prominent Democrats, including the Clintons, Obamas, and Jason Carter. Harris will close out the convention on Thursday, accepting the Democratic presidential nomination and outlining a roadmap for the future. Trump and his allies are planning a rival convention in his Chicago hotel, focusing on immigration, crime, and the economy.
news knowledge.title: Trump posts AI-generated image of Harris speaking at DNC with communist flags

news knowledge.eng_title: US Presidential Election 2024: Trump's Personal Attacks on Harris Backfire
news knowledge.summary: US Presidential candidate Kamala Harris has indirectly criticized her opponent Donald Trump for his rhetoric, saying 'Whoever demeans others is a coward.' Trump has been accused of spreading fake news and has been caught using AI-generated images to support his claims. He recently posted a photo of a Taylor Swift fan wearing a 'Swifties for Trump' t-shirt, but it was later revealed that the image was created using AI. Trump has also made personal attacks on Harris, calling her 'dumb' and 'irresponsible.' Michelle Obama is set to speak at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, where she will likely address Trump's personal attacks on Harris. Meanwhile, Trump has compared himself to Sophia Loren and Elizabeth Taylor, saying 'I look better than her.' Polls have shown that Trump's personal attacks on Harris have actually increased the number of women who do not support him.
news knowledge.title: US-Wahl 2024: Swift ein Trump-Fan? Ex-Präsident verbreitet KI-Fälschungen

news knowledge.eng_title: Pushkov: Harris' Campaign Using AI-Generated Photos and Videos
news knowledge.summary: Senator Alexey Pushkov stated that if Democrats succeed in using artificial intelligence during the US presidential election, they will 'launch AI to the full extent, if they can, and if there won't be a second shooter with an optical rifle that the police and Secret Service won't notice.' Pushkov commented on the information that Democratic vice-presidential candidate Kamala Harris and her team are using fake photos and videos generated by AI in their campaign. 'It's no surprise. This is just the beginning. The real 'fruits' will appear before and during the voting: AI will be fully launched if they can, and if there won't be a second shooter with an optical rifle that the police and Secret Service won't notice,' Pushkov wrote in his Telegram channel. Former US President Donald Trump also criticized Harris, accusing her of 'bought' participants at her campaign rallies. 'If Kamala Harris has a thousand people at her rally, the press goes crazy and says it's a massive event, and she just pays the crowd,' Trump said.
news knowledge.title: Это еще цветочки: Харрис уличили в использовании фейковых фотографий и видео — Пушков

news knowledge.eng_title: Is AI preferable to KI (Kamala Intelligence)?
news knowledge.summary: Kamala Harris, the US Vice President, has been appointed as the artificial intelligence (AI) czar by President Joe Biden. However, her handling of AI has been criticized, with some questioning her understanding of the technology. In a recent speech, Harris defined AI as 'artificial intelligence, it's about machine learning, and so the machine is taught.' Critics have pointed out that her comments and speeches on AI have been lacking in depth and expertise. The Biden administration has faced criticism for its approach to AI, with some accusing them of having 'double standards' when it comes to the technology. AI experts have defined AI as a field of computer science focused on creating systems that can perform tasks typically requiring human intelligence, including machine learning, natural language processing, and computer vision. The administration's handling of AI has been a topic of debate, with some calling for more informed and nuanced discussions on the subject.
news knowledge.title: Is AI preferable to KI (Kamala Intelligence)?

news knowledge.eng_title: AFT's Assembly Featured Kamala Harris, Debates on the Israel-Hamas War, and More
news knowledge.summary: The American Federation of Teachers (AFT) convention, held in July 2024, focused on the upcoming presidential election and featured Vice President Kamala Harris as a keynote speaker. The union endorsed Harris for president, citing her commitment to education and her willingness to take on the challenges facing the country. AFT President Randi Weingarten described the decision to endorse Harris as a 'no-brainer,' saying, 'If his vice president was willing to take up the baton and run with it, why wouldn't you go with his vice president?' The convention also saw the passage of 44 resolutions, including ones addressing artificial intelligence, over-testing, and the need for a ceasefire in Gaza. Weingarten won re-election as AFT president, despite being criticized by Republicans for her advocacy on education issues. The union's convention was seen as a key moment in the lead-up to the 2024 presidential election.
news knowledge.title: AFT's Assembly Featured Kamala Harris, Debates on the Israel-Hamas War, and More

news knowledge.eng_title: 'Fake, manipulated lies,' says Kamala Harris campaign after Elon Musk shares AI-generated parody clip without disclaimer | Today News
news knowledge.summary: Elon Musk shared an AI-generated video of US Vice President Kamala Harris without a disclaimer, which mimics her voice and says she is the Democrat candidate for president because Joe Biden exposed his senility at a debate. The video has raised concerns about the power of artificial intelligence to mislead in US Presidential elections. The Kamala Harris campaign responded, saying 'We believe the American people want the real freedom, opportunity and security Vice President Harris is offering, not the fake, manipulated lies of Elon Musk and Donald Trump.'
news knowledge.title: 'Fake, manipulated lies,' says Kamala Harris campaign after Elon Musk shares AI-generated parody clip without disclaimer | Today News

news knowledge.eng_title: President Biden Speech Shocks Nation. Was it really AI Biden?
news knowledge.summary: President Biden delivered an unexpected Oval Office address, sparking online speculation and debate about his decision not to seek re-election in 2024. The speech emphasized his commitment to the nation's well-being, but instead fueled conspiracy theories and questions about his authenticity. Some online users claimed that Biden's appearance was artificially generated, while others noted his unusual complexion and speech patterns. Official sources have not confirmed any use of AI or pre-recording techniques. Biden's endorsement of Vice President Kamala Harris signals a shift in Democratic leadership and raises questions about his future role in American politics.
news knowledge.title: President Biden Speech Shocks Nation. Was it really AI Biden?

news knowledge.eng_title: Kamala Harris On AI, TikTok And Big Tech Breakups: 'Privacy Is Not Being Compromised'
news knowledge.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris, the potential Democratic nominee for the 2024 presidential election, has expressed concerns about artificial intelligence (AI) and big technology companies. Harris has called for AI regulation, rejecting the idea that it's a choice between protecting the public and advancing innovation. She has also stated that big technology companies should be regulated to ensure consumer privacy is not compromised. Harris has a history with the tech sector, having served as California's Attorney General and San Francisco's District Attorney. Her stance on big technology companies and AI regulation could become a major topic in the 2024 election, particularly with the potential for a ban on TikTok and the breakup of companies like Alphabet and Meta.
news knowledge.title: Kamala Harris On AI, TikTok And Big Tech Breakups: 'Privacy Is Not Being Compromised'

news knowledge.eng_title: One business world concern that is already a focus for Kamala Harris: AI
news knowledge.summary: Kamala Harris, the current US Vice President, has been focusing on artificial intelligence (AI) and has been called the 'AI czar' by Joe Biden. Harris has been involved in shaping the White House's approach to AI and has been a key player in the government's efforts to ensure AI systems are safe. As the Democratic nominee, Harris's approach to AI is likely to be a focus of her campaign, and she has already received endorsements from tech leaders such as Reid Hoffman and Dmitri Mehlhorn. Harris has also been vocal about the need for government oversight and regulation of AI, and has criticized big tech companies for prioritizing profit over the wellbeing of their customers and the safety of their communities. Her stance on AI sets her apart from Donald Trump, who has promised to reverse Biden's approach and replace it with a new one focused on 'human flourishing'. The issue of AI is likely to be a hot topic in the 2024 election, with concerns about over-regulation and the potential for bias in AI systems being raised by both sides.
news knowledge.title: One business world concern that is already a focus for Kamala Harris: AI

news knowledge.eng_title: Kamala Harris's Stance on Technology and AI Regulation
news knowledge.summary: Kamala Harris, the Vice President of the United States, is being considered as a potential Democratic nominee for the 2024 presidential election. As a former Attorney General of California and Senator, Harris has a strong background in technology and has expressed her concerns about the regulation of artificial intelligence (AI). Harris has been critical of the CEOs of large tech companies and has advocated for greater regulation. She has also emphasized the importance of balancing innovation with consumer protection. As Vice President, Harris has continued to promote the idea that protecting the public and advancing innovation are not mutually exclusive. She has also expressed her concerns about the security of TikTok and has called for a pragmatic approach to addressing national security concerns. Harris's stance on AI regulation is seen as a key issue in the upcoming election, with some investors in Silicon Valley expressing concerns that the Biden administration may 'overregulate' the industry.
news knowledge.title: Kamala Harris: Lo que piensa sobre la Tecnología y Regulación de la IA
